template.template: Template HP Insight Management WBEM Providers
template.name: Template HP Insight Management WBEM Providers
template.description:
HP Insight Management WBEM Providers Tested on Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1, Windows Server 2012 R2, Zabbix v 2.4.
https://github.com/zbx-sadman/HP http://h10032.www1.hp.com/ctg/Manual/c02435636
Requirement: - HP Insight Management WBEM Providers - wmi_helper.ps1 >= v.0.9.0 (to support wmi.helper[] keys)

item.name: Chassis package type
item.description: ChassisPackageType indicates the physical form factor for the type of Chassis. This property may have a value when the PackageType property contains the value 3 "Chassis Frame". A value of 28 "Blade Enclosure" shall indicate the Chassis is designed to contain one or more PhysicalPackage(s) of PackageType 16 "Blade" or PackageType 17 "Blade Expansion".

item.name: Chassis S/N
item.description: A manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the Physical Element.

item.name: ILo health state
item.description: Indicates the current health of the element. This attribute expresses the health of this element but not necessarily that of its subcomponents. The possible values are 0 to 30, where 5 means the element is entirely healthy and 30 means the element is completely non-functional. The following continuum is defined: "Non-recoverable Error" (30) - The element has completely failed, and recovery is not possible. All functionality provided by this element has been lost. "Critical Failure" (25) - The element is non-functional and recovery might not be possible. "Major Failure" (20) - The element is failing. It is possible that some or all of the functionality of this component is degraded or not working. "Minor Failure" (15) - All functionality is available but some might be degraded. "Degraded/Warning" (10) - The element is in working order and all functionality is provided. However, the element is not working to the best of its abilities. For example, the element might not be operating at optimal performance or it might be reporting recoverable errors. "OK" (5) - The element is fully functional and is operating within normal operational parameters and without error. "Unknown" (0) - The implementation cannot report on HealthState at this time. DMTF has reserved the unused portion of the continuum for additional HealthStates in the future.

item.name: Manufacturer
item.description: The name of the organization responsible for producing the PhysicalElement.

item.name: Model
item.description: Name by which the physical element is generally known.

item.name: Product ID
item.description: The HP Product ID for the physical package. The Product ID is sometimes necessary to uniquely identify a HP product as the HP_ComputerSystem.SerialNumber values can be reused.

item.name: Rack mountable
item.description:
RackMountable indicates whether or not the chassis is Rack Mountable.
• 0 (Unknown) • 1 (True) • 2 (False)

item.name: State of the computer UID (led)
item.description:
State of the computer system Unit Identifier (UID) LED (writable property): • 0 (Unknown) • 2 (On) • 3 (Off) • 4 (Unsupported) • 5 (Alternating).
Only 2 (On) and 3 (Off) are supported for writing. The Lights Out Remote Console is active and any writes to the property are ignored.

item.name: TPMModule
item.description: Conditional property containing the installed and enabled state of the Trusted Platform Module: • 2 (Absent) • 3 (Present and Enabled) • 4 (Present but Disabled If the system does not have a TPM socket on the system board; this property is not populated.

item_prototype.name: {#CAPTION} auto sense
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select AutoSense from HP_EthernetPort where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: AutoSense indicates whether the NetworkPort is capable of automatically determining the speed or other communications characteristics of the attached network media.

item_prototype.name: {#CAPTION} current speed
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select Speed from HP_EthernetPort where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: The current bandwidth of the Port in Bits per Second. For ports that vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this property should contain the nominal bandwidth.

item_prototype.name: {#CAPTION} full duplex
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select FullDuplex from HP_EthernetPort where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: FullDuplex indicates that the port is operating in full duplex mode.

item_prototype.name: {#CAPTION} health state
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select HealthState from HP_EthernetPort where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: 5 (OK) if port has link, 20 (Major Failure) otherwise

item_prototype.name: {#CAPTION} link technology
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select LinkTechnology from HP_EthernetPort where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: An enumeration of the types of links. When set to 1 ("Other"), the related property OtherLinkTechnology contains a string description of the type of link. Unknown (0) Other (1) Ethernet (2) IB (3) FC (4) FDDI (5) ATM (6) Token Ring (7) Frame Relay (8) Infrared (9) BlueTooth (10) Wireless LAN (11)

item_prototype.name: {#CAPTION} MTU
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select ActiveMaximumTransmissionUnit from HP_EthernetPort where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: The active or negotiated maximum transmission unit (MTU) that can be supported.

item_prototype.name: {#CAPTION} operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HP_EthernetPort where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\",0]

item_prototype.name: {#CAPTION} port type
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select PortType from HP_EthernetPort where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: The specific mode that is currently enabled for the port. When set to 1 ("Other"), the related property OtherPortType contains a string description of the type of port. Unknown (0) Other (1) Copper 10BaseT (50) 10-100BaseT (51) 100BaseT (52) 1000BaseT (53) 2500BaseT (54) 10GBaseT (55) 10GBase-CX4 (56) Fiber 100Base-FX (100) 100Base-SX (101) 1000Base-SX (102) 1000Base-LX (103) 1000Base-CX (104) 10GBase-SR (105) 10GBase-SW (106) 10GBase-LX4 (107) 10GBase-LR (108) 10GBase-LW (109) 10GBase-ER (110) 10GBase-EW (111) Vendor Reserved (16000..65535)

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} health state
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select HealthState from HP_Fan where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HP_Fan where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\",0]

item_prototype.name: {#MANUFACTURER} {#NAME} form factor
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select FormFactor from HP_MemoryModule where Tag="{#TAG}"]
item_prototype.description: The implementation form factor for the Chip. For example, values such as SIMM (7), TSOP (9) or PGA (10) can be specified.

item_prototype.name: {#MANUFACTURER} {#NAME} health state
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select HealthState from HP_MemoryModule where Tag="{#TAG}"]
item_prototype.description: Indicates the current health of the element. This attribute expresses the health of this element but not necessarily that of its subcomponents. The possible values are 0 to 30, where 5 means the element is entirely healthy and 30 means the element is completely non-functional. The following continuum is defined: "Non-recoverable Error" (30) - The element has completely failed, and recovery is not possible. All functionality provided by this element has been lost. "Critical Failure" (25) - The element is non-functional and recovery might not be possible. "Major Failure" (20) - The element is failing. It is possible that some or all of the functionality of this component is degraded or not working. "Minor Failure" (15) - All functionality is available but some might be degraded. "Degraded/Warning" (10) - The element is in working order and all functionality is provided. However, the element is not working to the best of its abilities. For example, the element might not be operating at optimal performance or it might be reporting recoverable errors. "OK" (5) - The element is fully functional and is operating within normal operational parameters and without error. "Unknown" (0) - The implementation cannot report on HealthState at this time. DMTF has reserved the unused portion of the continuum for additional HealthStates in the future.

item_prototype.name: {#MANUFACTURER} {#NAME} max memory speed
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select MaxMemorySpeed from HP_MemoryModule where Tag="{#TAG}"]
item_prototype.description: The maximum speed (in MHz) of PhysicalMemory.

item_prototype.name: {#MANUFACTURER} {#NAME} minimum voltage
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select MinimumVoltage from HP_MemoryModule where Tag="{#TAG}"]
item_prototype.description: This value specifies the minimum voltage needed for the memory module to operate in millivolts. If this value cannot be determined, then a value of 0 will be returned.

item_prototype.name: {#MANUFACTURER} {#NAME} operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HP_MemoryModule where Tag=\"{#TAG}\",0]

item_prototype.name: {#MANUFACTURER} {#NAME} P/N
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select PartNumber from HP_MemoryModule where Tag="{#TAG}"]
item_prototype.description: The part number assigned by the organization that is responsible for producing or manufacturing the PhysicalElement.

item_prototype.name: {#MANUFACTURER} {#NAME} S/N
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select SerialNumber from HP_MemoryModule where Tag="{#TAG}"]
item_prototype.description: Manufacturer allocated serial number of the memory module. This property is conditional. It is populated if the data is available.

discovery_rule.name: HP numeric sensor (ambient / external / room)
discovery_rule.key: wmi.helper[discovery, ROOT\HPQ,Select * from HP_NumericSensor where NumericSensorType=\"10\"]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} (ambient) current value
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CurrentReading from HP_NumericSensor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}" and NumericSensorType="10"]
item_prototype.description: The current value indicated by the Sensor.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} (ambient) operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HP_NumericSensor where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\" and NumericSensorType=\"10\",0]

discovery_rule.name: HP numeric sensor (CPU board)
discovery_rule.key: wmi.helper[discovery, ROOT\HPQ,Select * from HP_NumericSensor where NumericSensorType=\"5\"]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} (CPU board) current value
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CurrentReading from HP_NumericSensor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}" and NumericSensorType="5"]
item_prototype.description: The current value indicated by the Sensor.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} (CPU board) operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HP_NumericSensor where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\" and NumericSensorType=\"5\",0]

discovery_rule.name: HP numeric sensor (memory board)
discovery_rule.key: wmi.helper[discovery, ROOT\HPQ,Select * from HP_NumericSensor where NumericSensorType=\"6\"]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} (memory board) current value
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CurrentReading from HP_NumericSensor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}" and NumericSensorType="6"]
item_prototype.description: The current value indicated by the Sensor.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} (memory board) operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HP_NumericSensor where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\" and NumericSensorType=\"6\",0]

discovery_rule.name: HP numeric sensor (power supply bays)
discovery_rule.key: wmi.helper[discovery, ROOT\HPQ,Select * from HP_NumericSensor where NumericSensorType=\"9\"]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} (power supply bays) current value
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CurrentReading from HP_NumericSensor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}" and NumericSensorType="9"]
item_prototype.description: The current value indicated by the Sensor.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} (power supply bays) operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HP_NumericSensor where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\" and NumericSensorType=\"9\",0]

discovery_rule.name: HP numeric sensor (system board)
discovery_rule.key: wmi.helper[discovery, ROOT\HPQ,Select * from HP_NumericSensor where NumericSensorType=\"2\"]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} (system board) current value
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CurrentReading from HP_NumericSensor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}" and NumericSensorType="2"]
item_prototype.description: The current value indicated by the Sensor.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} (system board) operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HP_NumericSensor where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\" and NumericSensorType=\"2\",0]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} consumption
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CurrentReading from HP_PowerMeter where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} health state
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select HealthState from HP_PowerSupply where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HP_PowerSupply where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\",0]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} P/N
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select PartNumber from HP_PowerSupplyModule where Tag="{#DEVICEID}"]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} primary status
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select PrimaryStatus from HP_PowerSupply where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} can be FRUed
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select CanBeFRUed from HP_ProcessorChip where Name=\"{#NAME}\"]
item_prototype.description: Boolean that indicates whether this PhysicalElement can be FRUed (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} caption
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select Caption from HP_Processor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: The Caption property is a short textual description (one- line string) of the object.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} current clock speed
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CurrentClockSpeed from HP_Processor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: The current speed (in MHz) of this Processor.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} description
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select Description from HP_Processor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: The Description property provides a textual description of the object.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} health state
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select HealthState from HP_Processor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: Indicates the current health of the element. This attribute expresses the health of this element but not necessarily that of its subcomponents. The possible values are 0 to 30, where 5 means the element is entirely healthy and 30 means the element is completely non-functional. The following continuum is defined: "Non-recoverable Error" (30) - The element has completely failed, and recovery is not possible. All functionality provided by this element has been lost. "Critical Failure" (25) - The element is non-functional and recovery might not be possible. "Major Failure" (20) - The element is failing. It is possible that some or all of the functionality of this component is degraded or not working. "Minor Failure" (15) - All functionality is available but some might be degraded. "Degraded/Warning" (10) - The element is in working order and all functionality is provided. However, the element is not working to the best of its abilities. For example, the element might not be operating at optimal performance or it might be reporting recoverable errors. "OK" (5) - The element is fully functional and is operating within normal operational parameters and without error. "Unknown" (0) - The implementation cannot report on HealthState at this time. DMTF has reserved the unused portion of the continuum for additional HealthStates in the future.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} max clock speed
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select MaxClockSpeed from HP_Processor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: The maximum speed (in MHz) of this Processor.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} number of enabled cores
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select NumberOfEnabledCores from HP_Processor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: Number of processor cores enabled for processor.

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HP_Processor where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\",0]

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} powered on
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select PoweredOn from HP_ProcessorChip where Name=\"{#NAME}\"]
item_prototype.description: Boolean that indicates whether the PhysicalElement is powered on (TRUE) or is currently off (FALSE).

item_prototype.name: {#NAME} status
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CPUStatus from HP_Processor where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: The CPUStatus property that indicates the current status of the Processor. • 1 (CPU Enabled) • 2 (CPU Disabled by User using BIOS Setup) • 3 (CPU Disabled By BIOS (POST Error)) • 7 (Other)

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" battery status
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select BatteryStatus from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Indicates the current status of the Battery. The enumeration's values are self- explanatory.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" cache board present
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CacheBoardPresent from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Cache board(s) present on this controller.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" cache has battery
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CacheHasBattery from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Cache has battery backup.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" cache module temperature
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CacheModuleTemperature from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Cache Module Temperature in degrees Celsius.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" cache parity read errors
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CacheParityReadErrors from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Cache parity Read errors.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" cache parity write errors
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CacheParityWriteErrors from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Cache parity Write errors.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" cache read percent
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CacheReadPercent from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Cache Read Percent defines the amount of cache reserved for read operations. For cache without battery backup, then this would be 100%

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" cache size total
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CacheSizeTotal from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Total Cache memory size in bytes.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" cache state
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CacheState from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Cache module error code. This is a enumeration of possible cache errors.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" cache write percent
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select CacheWritePercent from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Cache Write Percent defines the amount of cache reserved for write operations.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" FW version
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select Version from HPSA_Product where IdentifyingNumber="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Product version information.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" HBA mode supported
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select IsHBAModeSupported from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Specifies whether this controller supports HBA mode.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HPSA_ArrayController where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\",0]

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" rebuild priority
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select RebuildPriority from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Indicates the current priority Setting for the given background controller operation. The enumeration's values are self- explanatory.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" sanitize erase supported
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select IsSanitizeEraseSupported from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Specifies whether the controller supports Sanitize erase.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" split cache supported
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select IsSplitCacheSupported from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Specifies whether this controller supports the Split cache.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" status
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select ControllerStatus from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Indicatest the current status of the Controller. The enumerations are self explanatory.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" super cap temperature
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select SuperCapTemperature from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: SuperCapacitor Temperature in degrees Celsius.

item_prototype.name: "{#ELEMENTNAME}" temperature
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select ControllerTemperature from HPSA_ArrayController where Name="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: Controller Temperature in degrees Celsius.

item_prototype.name: Drive #{#NAME} configuration
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select DriveConfiguration from HPSA_DiskDrive where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: Enumeration of types that describe the drive configuration. The enumeration's values are self- explanatory.

item_prototype.name: Drive #{#NAME} FW version
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select VersionString from HPSA_DiskDriveFirmware where SerialNumber="{#NAME}"]
item_prototype.description: A string representing the complete software version information - for example, '12.1(3)T'. This string and the numeric major/minor/revision/build properties are complementary. Since vastly different representations and semantics exist for versions, it is not assumed that one representation is sufficient to permit a client to perform computations (i.e., the values are numeric) and a user to recognize the software's version (i.e., the values are understandable and readable). Hence, both numeric and string representations of version are provided.

item_prototype.name: Drive #{#NAME} location
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select PhysicalPosition from HPSA_DiskDriveLocation where Name="{#Name}"]
item_prototype.description: Position is a free-form string that indicates the placement of a PhysicalElement. It can specify slot information on a HostingBoard, mounting site in a Cabinet, or latitude and longitude information, for example, from a GPS. It is part of the key of the Location object.

item_prototype.name: Drive #{#NAME} model
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select ElementName from HPSA_DiskDriveFirmware where SerialNumber="{#NAME}"]

item_prototype.name: Drive #{#NAME} negotiated interface speed
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select NegotiatedSpeed from HPSA_DiskDrive where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: When several bus and connection speeds are possible, the NegotiatedSpeed property defines the one that is in use between the Devices. Speed is specified in bits per second. If connection or bus speeds are not negotiated, or if this information is not available or not important to Device management, the property should be set to 0.

item_prototype.name: Drive #{#NAME} operational status
item_prototype.key: wmi.helper[get,root\hpq,select OperationalStatus from HPSA_DiskDrive where DeviceID=\"{#DEVICEID}\",0]

item_prototype.name: Drive #{#NAME} rotational speed
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select DriveRotationalSpeed from HPSA_DiskDrive where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: Drive rotational Speed in RPM.

item_prototype.name: Drive #{#NAME} SSD wear status
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select SSDWearStatus from HPSA_DiskDrive where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: This is the wearout status of the Solid State drive.

item_prototype.name: Drive #{#NAME} total power on hours
item_prototype.key: wmi.get[root\hpq,select TotalPowerOnHours from HPSA_DiskDrive where DeviceID="{#DEVICEID}"]
item_prototype.description: The total number of hours that this Device has been powered.
